comments.body: nether wood doesnt burn so their boats shouldnt great idea
Why a new dimension? I think that doesn't make a lot of sense.
perfect. however. pale moss isn't very white, meaning that it would just look like cobble stone with more gray on it.
OMG great Idea
There could also be pale mossy stone bricks, as well as pale mossy deepslate bricks.
Cobble is gray... Pale Moss is also gray... Wouldn't that just be more gray?

I think this would go well on deepslate since it's spooky, since deepslate doesn't have a mossy variant yet. That way we also don't have to oversaturate the block selection with every combination. There will be enough parity with normal mossy stone because hanging moss can work like vines work and visually there will be contrast.
it would just look more gray but they should add it anyways so that the mossy deepslate still fits.
Definitely
little change but big impacts on QOL

Maybe you could make a scarecrow and the creaking wouldn't move if a scarecrow is watching them. Also you could add crows that might steal dropped items or crops that would be scared away by a scarecrow.
We need this.

I think you should be able to dye the pale pumpkin other colors for example you could dye it orange and it would look like a regular pumpkin just with a different carving, or regular pumpkins could have different carvings. I personally want only pale pumpkins to have different carvings and be dyeable to make people go to the pale garden to find them.
Or Lightning will Stun the Creaking, allowing Channeling to gain a new Use
yea like a level 1-5 light level. only when its activeated though.

nice idea, 100% original
this is a very useful idea

An End zombie/skeleton would have pretty big lore implications. It would essentially be confirming them as the pilots of end ship and the residents of end cities.
you whant to get us killed :O
I think there should be a setting, so you can turn it off if you want.
there need's to be stranger creatures
im ok for new mob, but not end variant tbh
YES this is so needed for more variety in orange colored builds or details utilizing orange coloration while still being a stone like texture.
make them blink

Yes.

Right now the Creaking's eyes ruin its camouflage, but fake eyes would force you to at least look twice.

Make them blink! Make them blink!

(IT would make it seem so much creepier!)
We NEED this!!
i think there is a wool that looks like planks with eyes in the legacy console console halloween texture pack
MAKE THE EYES TURN TO LOOK AT YOU
I think it would be better implemented if it was found in a structure.
Possibly, but this post is about the enchantment so I didn't want to throw a structure idea in there as well.
You could make the enchantment only obtainable at night in the pale garden. To incentivize facing the creaking.
It would be better if found in the end.
maybe sometimes inside the maze can spawn small decorative structures like statues or colums to show the fact that this was once a big cured garden

Crumbling statues in a once-beautiful garden... an abandoned mansion... A lit fireplace with a haunted feeling in the air... Great ideas! It sounds like one awesome ghost story. They should certainly add this to Minecraft. Only, what about the Creaking? Where does it fit into all this? Or what if the creaking roamed somewhere inside the Pale Manor... waiting for its prey to come around the corner...

I imagined the scene of being chased by a creaking inside the maze. trying to find an exit but have to continuosly look back to stop the creaking. you also can't cut trough walls because to do so you need to look away from it.

(I don't know how to replay to a specific comment, but I'm talking to you... "registered user" and thank you) :)
The Pale Manor sounds SUPER awesome. and the biome shuld be more like a garden
Why not just add quivers, they should be able to carry multiple stacks of arrows and have a way to switch the arrow type when you have the bow charged up (using scroll-item interactions).
Yeah.

They wouldn't add a unique function to the bundle like this, instead they would add an entirely new item. They should add the quiver, it could hold infinite arrows, and give players an easy way to change arrows without going into their inventory or filling their hotbar with arrows.
This would be great, it would be a good way for players to distinguish which arrows they want to use if their using tipped arrows. (Or mojang could just add quivers)

This is an interesting idea and I think it fits in well with the pale garden's theme of having some really weird and unique natural stuff, like pale moss and the creaking heart. I hope minecraft considers this, it's a really cool idea.

I'm not sure if they would add additional structures for the pale garden but something like Pale-Rooted dirt could work thematically and provide another shade of dirt block. It could generate like Podzol or Rooted Dirt when Pale Oak grows. And maybe breaking one has a chance to spawn a 'pale worm' like a silverfish.

Translator
 
 
 
 

Yeah, I think it's a good idea. And if possible a label text appear when we look a book in the chiselled bookshelf with the name of the book. Thanks that, we don't need to take the book to see the title.
We NEED this
like it but itll most likly be removed because its to vauge

This update isn't going to be as big as the tricky trials update or others before it. This is a game drop which Mojang has clarified, is much smaller than a regular update. On the flip side, however, we get more game drops. I'm pretty sure Mojang is close to being done adding content to this game drop, we already are getting a new biome, mob, mechanic, and tons of new building blocks. I would like them to add something practical to the gardens (so far all the rewards are decorative) but I don't think we're getting another mob, and if we get a structure it will be vary small, probably just the ruins of one house, nothing on the level of other structures because the attraction of this biome is the Creaking, that's what makes it special, not some structure.

As for armor trims, I agree, this update needs a trim.

I could be wrong, but this seems most likely to me.
yes the pale garden needs more
I would imagine the armor trim would drop from the creaking if the creaking heart was broken? A new armor trim would be another way to incentive going to the pale garden at night.
The Cherry Blossom Biome also needs more features. I'm thinking adding more Witches or VIllages would be good for these biomes
Seriously?
I like the idea of saving the last villager, but the Steve and Alex stuff would be kind of weird because of the new default skins.

There is no need to be harsh, at least explain why you disagree.

I think the save the villager idea is not bad, but the rest of this post is never going to be added. It involves stories, skin specific effects, and other unusual things. I suggest you look at the content already in the game and see if you can find anything even remotely similar to what you are suggesting. You will not find anything, this is how minecraft is and its not going to change unless it gets really unpopular.
omg i like the idea
The Pale Village actually sounds like a fantastic idea (besides the skin-specific ideas). Perhaps they could finally give the fletching table a purpose, too?
Neat idea!

Great idea, this is a brilliant way to make pale gardens good. Since resin is a farmable material and is pretty easy to get in both the pale garden and if you bring a creaking heart to your base, maybe it should be more like 2 seconds.
Good

I think that these caves should also generate under the biome old growth pine taiga and old growth spruce taiga as both of these trees (In real life) produce resin. And as I'm sure you know, amber is just fossilized tree resin. This would also make this new cave biome more common as the pale garden is quite rare.

There is a related feedback post. This post however is an older post of this similar idea.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/31335668373389-Resin-Cave

overal every addition to archeology would be great.. so far sadly that feature feels most disconnected, villagers dont trade archeology-related goods, there isnt archeologist profession..
not sure what small animals in amber could be for or how they would look, after all, we likely cant start jurasic park in minecraft, but I would like idea of some special caves under pale forests, even if it would be pale version of those caves with moss and stuff

This is a wonderful idea! I have been worried about that for awhile, I'm the type of player who will use whatever loop holes he can get if it's more convenient/safer, while also being disappointed that its so easy. I want the Creaking to be at least a small challenge (preferably a big challenge but that seems unlikely). I suggest that, in edition to your idea, the Creaking should despawn if it can't pathfind to the player. That way the player can trap it, look away, and when he looks back it will be gone and in a different place.

The creaking should also be able to climb up blocks and be immune to fall damage.

This would also allow creakings to get around barracades and dug-out channels.
merci beaucoup pour les personnes qui vote!!!
I think that is a pretty cool idea. To add on to that idea of ruins. I think that abandoned villages should have a higher spawn rate inside the pale garden biome.
maybe he has a more powerful punch attack

Another suggestion- if it fails to path towards you after 3 seconds (such as being stuck in a hole, or it's just stuck in general) it will disappear for a few seconds and reappear in a new spot. So therefore you can't abuse it by placing it in a hole to make it immobile.

It could also do with a bit of a strength boost, as at the moment it feels more like an annoyance than a danger. Not too much of a buff though, maybe an extra 2.5 hearts or so.
